verses.verse: And if any <S%H5315>one<s%> <S%H2398>sin<s%>, in that he <S%H8085>heareth<s%> the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of <S%H423>adjuration<s%>, he being a <S%H5707>witness<s%>, <S%H176>whether<s%> he hath <S%H7200>seen<s%> or <S%H3045>known<s%>, if he do not <S%H5046>utter<s%> <S%H5375>it<s%>, then he shall bear his <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>.

Or if any <S%H5315>one<s%> <S%H5060>touch<s%> any <S%H2931>unclean<s%> <S%H1697>thing<s%>, whether it be the <S%H5038>carcass<s%> of an <S%H2931>unclean<s%> <S%H2416>beast<s%>, or the <S%H5038>carcass<s%> of <S%H2931>unclean<s%> <S%H929>cattle<s%>, or the <S%H5038>carcass<s%> of <S%H2931>unclean<s%> creeping <S%H8318>things<s%>, and it be <S%H5956>hidden<s%> from <S%H2931>him<s%>, and he be unclean, then he shall be <S%H816>guilty<s%>.

Or if he <S%H5060>touch<s%> the <S%H2932>uncleanness<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%>, whatsoever his <S%H2932>uncleanness<s%> be wherewith he is <S%H2930>unclean<s%>, and it be <S%H5956>hid<s%> from <S%H3045>him<s%>; when he knoweth of <S%H816>it<s%>, then he shall be guilty.

Or if any <S%H5315>one<s%> <S%H7650>swear<s%> <S%H981>rashly<s%> with his <S%H8193>lips<s%> to do <S%H7489>evil<s%>, or to do <S%H3190>good<s%>, whatsoever it be that a <S%H120>man<s%> shall utter <S%H981>rashly<s%> with an <S%H7621>oath<s%>, and it be <S%H5956>hid<s%> from <S%H3045>him<s%>; when he knoweth of <S%H816>it<s%>, then he shall be guilty in one of these <S%H259>things<s%>.
And it shall <S%H816>be<s%>, when he shall be guilty in <S%H259>one<s%> of these <S%H3034>things<s%>, that he shall confess that wherein he hath <S%H2398>sinned<s%>:

and he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> his <S%H817>trespass-offering<s%> unto <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> for his <S%H2403>sin<s%> which he hath <S%H2398>sinned<s%>, a <S%H5347>female<s%> from the <S%H6629>flock<s%>, a <S%H3776>lamb<s%> or <S%H8166>a<s%> <S%H8166>goat<s%>, for a <S%H2403>sin-offering<s%>; and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him as concerning his <S%H2403>sin<s%>.

And if <S%H3027>his<s%> means suffice <S%H1767>not<s%> <S%H5060>for<s%> a <S%H7716>lamb<s%>, then he shall <S%H5060>bring<s%> <S%H854>his<s%> <S%H817>trespass-offering<s%> for that wherein he hath <S%H2398>sinned<s%>, <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H8449>turtle-doves<s%>, or <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H1121>young<s%> <S%H3123>pigeons<s%>, unto <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>; <S%H259>one<s%> for a <S%H2403>sin-offering<s%>, and the <S%H259>other<s%> for a <S%H2403>burnt-offering<s%>.

And he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> them unto the <S%H3548>priest<s%>, who shall <S%H7126>offer<s%> that which is for the <S%H2403>sin-offering<s%> <S%H7223>first<s%>, and wring <S%H4454>off<s%> its <S%H7218>head<s%> <S%H4136>from<s%> its <S%H6203>neck<s%>, but shall not divide it <S%H914>asunder<s%>:

and he shall <S%H5137>sprinkle<s%> of the <S%H1818>blood<s%> of the <S%H2403>sin-offering<s%> upon the <S%H7023>side<s%> of the <S%H4196>altar<s%>; and the <S%H7604>rest<s%> of the <S%H1818>blood<s%> shall be drained <S%H4680>out<s%> at the <S%H3247>base<s%> of the <S%H4196>altar<s%>: it is a <S%H2403>sin-offering<s%>.

And he shall <S%H6213>offer<s%> the <S%H8145>second<s%> for a <S%H5930>burnt-offering<s%>, according to the <S%H4941>ordinance<s%>; and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him as concerning his <S%H2403>sin<s%> which he hath <S%H2398>sinned<s%>, and he shall be <S%H5545>forgiven<s%>.

But if <S%H3027>his<s%> means <S%H5381>suffice<s%> not for <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H8449>turtle-doves<s%>, or <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H1121>young<s%> <S%H3123>pigeons<s%>, then he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> his <S%H7133>oblation<s%> for that wherein he hath <S%H2398>sinned<s%>, the <S%H6224>tenth<s%> part of an <S%H374>ephah<s%> of fine <S%H5560>flour<s%> for a <S%H2403>sin-offering<s%>: he shall <S%H7760>put<s%> no <S%H8081>oil<s%> upon <S%H5414>it<s%>, neither shall he put any <S%H3828>frankincense<s%> <S%H2403>thereon<s%>; for it is a sin-offering.

And he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> it to the <S%H3548>priest<s%>, and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall <S%H7061>take<s%> his <S%H4393>handful<s%> of it as the <S%H234>memorial<s%> <S%H6999>thereof<s%>, and burn it on the <S%H4196>altar<s%>, upon the offerings of <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> made by <S%H801>fire<s%>: it is a <S%H2403>sin-offering<s%>.

And the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him as touching his <S%H2403>sin<s%> that he hath <S%H2398>sinned<s%> in <S%H259>any<s%> of these <S%H5545>things<s%>, and he shall be forgiven: and the remnant shall be the <S%H3548>priest<s%>'s, as the <S%H4503>meal-offering<s%>.

If any <S%H5315>one<s%> <S%H4603>commit<s%> a <S%H4604>trespass<s%>, and <S%H2398>sin<s%> <S%H7684>unwittingly<s%>, in the holy <S%H6944>things<s%> of <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>; then he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> his <S%H817>trespass-offering<s%> unto <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>, a <S%H352>ram<s%> without <S%H8549>blemish<s%> out of the <S%H6629>flock<s%>, according to thy <S%H6187>estimation<s%> in <S%H3701>silver<s%> by <S%H8255>shekels<s%>, after the <S%H8255>shekel<s%> of the <S%H6944>sanctuary<s%>, for a <S%H817>trespass-offering<s%>:

and he shall make <S%H7999>restitution<s%> for that which he hath done <S%H2398>amiss<s%> in the holy <S%H6944>thing<s%>, and shall <S%H3254>add<s%> the fifth <S%H2549>part<s%> <S%H5414>thereto<s%>, and give it unto the <S%H3548>priest<s%>; and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him with the <S%H352>ram<s%> of the <S%H817>trespass-offering<s%>, and he shall be <S%H5545>forgiven<s%>.

And if any <S%H5315>one<s%> <S%H2398>sin<s%>, and <S%H6213>do<s%> <S%H259>any<s%> of the things which <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> hath <S%H4687>commanded<s%> not to be <S%H6213>done<s%>; though he <S%H3045>knew<s%> it <S%H816>not<s%>, yet is he guilty, and shall <S%H5375>bear<s%> his <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>.

And he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> a <S%H352>ram<s%> without <S%H8549>blemish<s%> out of the <S%H6629>flock<s%>, according to thy <S%H6187>estimation<s%>, for a <S%H817>trespass-offering<s%>, unto the <S%H3548>priest<s%>; and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him concerning the thing wherein he <S%H7683>erred<s%> <S%H7684>unwittingly<s%> and <S%H3045>knew<s%> it <S%H5545>not<s%>, and he shall be forgiven.
It is a <S%H817>trespass-offering<s%>: he is <S%H816>certainly<s%> <S%H816>guilty<s%> before <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>.
